author: Lalatendu Mishra
text:
TIME magazine, in its 93-year history, will, for the first time, give away awards to recognise excellence. Indicating India’s future role in global manufacturing, TIME will give away manufacturing excellence awards in India.

Time Inc., the publisher of TIME, has partnered with management consulting firm McKinsey & Company to organise an award ceremony at the Make in India week. The awards will be given in three categories — excellence in manufacturing, innovation and entrepreneurship. The winners will receive the award from Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

Norman Pearlstine, Executive Vice President & Chief Content Officer, Time Inc., told The Hindu : “The PM has shown a strong interest in international trade, in attracting foreign investment and creating world class Indian companies which can compete globally ... We have created an award that respects a lot of intellectual rigor, intellectual discipline and we are very happy to have the opportunity to participate in this Make in India week.”
title: Time Inc. to give awards of excellence
